abstract.text: Publishes elements only after a specified time interval elapses between events.

inlineContent.text: The time the publisher should wait before publishing an element.

Scheduler options that customize this publisherâ€™s delivery of elements.
A publisher that publishes events only after a specified time elapses.

operator to control the number of values and time between delivery of values from the upstream publisher. This operator is useful to process bursty or high-volume event streams where you need to reduce the number of values delivered to the downstream to a rate you specify.
publishes elements on a schedule defined by the
array. The array is composed of tuples representing a value sent by the
ranging from one-quarter second up to 2 seconds that drives a delivery timer. As the queue builds, elements arriving faster than one-half second
are discarded, while elements arriving at a rate slower than

code: //  Here is the event flow shown from the perspective of time, showing value delivery through the `debounce()` operator:
//  Time 0.25: Send index 1. Index 0 was waiting and is discarded.
//  Time 0.75: Debounce period ends, publish index 1.
//  Time 1.25: Send index 3. Index 2 was waiting and is discarded.
//  Time 1.5: Send index 4. Index 3 was waiting and is discarded.
//  Time 2: Debounce period ends, publish index 4. Also, send index 5.
//  Time 2.5: Debounce period ends, publish index 5.

abstract.text: Customize handling of asynchronous events by combining event-processing operators.
A subject that broadcasts elements to downstream subscribers.
Publishes elements only after a specified time interval elapses between events.
Attaches a subscriber with closure-based behavior to a publisher that never fails.
A namespace for types that serve as publishers.
A publisher that publishes elements only after a specified time interval elapses between events.
A publisher that republishes elements until another publisher emits an element.
Publishes elements only after a specified time interval elapses between events.
Delays delivery of all output to the downstream receiver by a specified amount of time on a particular scheduler.
Measures and emits the time interval between events received from an upstream publisher.
Publishes either the most-recent or first element published by the upstream publisher in the specified time interval.
Terminates publishing if the upstream publisher exceeds the specified time interval without producing an element.
A protocol that defines when and how to execute a closure.
A type that defines options accepted by the scheduler.
Describes an instant in time for this scheduler.
A type that represents the distance between two values.
